messages.message: If i’m not wrong this can be done via the API but not via the UI. I don’t think we document that endpoint though.
cc @Wilson for the API that can delete a job?

I'm not aware of an API that can delete an app run job and its contents that meets @ChrisM’s use case points above

cc @Adam In case I missed anything

I don’t think any API exists that can delete the app run metadata from the DB, so it will always appear in the runs table. We actually went through this thought process when deciding what to do with app runs when unmounting a drive, and we’ve basically decided that app runs metadata persists in that case.

What we can do via API is delete the actual output folder from the filesystem which is where all PII is stored. In that case you would still see the run in the table UI but when you clicked the results link you would get an error that the data can’t be found
